name: Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family just stayed at the Metropolitan for four nights. The rooms are clean, modern, spacious and well lit. The bathroom is large and has all amenities. There is a nice lap pool, weight room and exercise area. Every area of this hotel is very well maintained, very clean and bright. Every single staff person with whom we came into contact went above and beyond to answer our questions and make sure we were comfortable. The location is downtown and right near the train station and every business one would need during a stay in a big city. We had an excellent rate through Travelzoo that included free parking. Because of this, I highly recommend The Metropolitan and look forward to a return visit
reviews.title: As close to perfect as one can find...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arrived in Vancouver Saturday mid-day, for overnight before embarking on cruise Sunday afternoon. Could not get early check-in, but hotel was very gracious, receiving our luggage and responding to inquiries about the surrounding area. Hungry and tired, we thought to perhaps hang out in the hotel restaurant over a bite of lunch. Prices were outrageous, but we were prepared to indulge that. No, what turned us out on unfamiliar streets was the breath-taking SNOBBERY of the restaurant staff. The restaurant was open, but completely empty, and apparently they wanted to keep it that way! Ignored us totally, leaving us standing at the door, looking expectantly back at the staff clustered around the bar. . . It was imPRESSive! We looked at the menu, ascertained that the restaurant was INDEED "OPEN," so to speak, and finally left before our laughter overcame us. We were guessing they were 'WAY better than some middle-aged US woman with her grey hair in a bun! ! ! We wound up walking about three or four blocks out to the Vancouver Museum of Art, where a very attractive little restaurant was serving lunch - - and managed to score a little art, besides!
reviews.title: Great Hotel. . . Restaurant? Not so much. . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning at checkout, we wanted to leave our luggage at the hotel while we completed the (terrific) trolley tour we had begun the afternoon before. The head bellman said they would be happy to keep it for us, but recommended that we take it on to the dock and check it in, thus missing the crowds that would develop that afternoon. GRAND advice, and we took it, leaving us free to just sail through the rest of our day in Vancouver until time to get on the boat.
reviews.title: Perfect for a pre- cruise stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Vancouver is a spectacular city, and we wished so much that we had scheduled another night or two there, so as to more fully enjoy the beauty. The trolley tour runs in two loops, and is the ideal way to hit the sights quickly. With extra time to get off and back on, we could have seen most of the city from that tour. Even so, we got a thorough introduction to the great beauty and fascinating charms of the city. A-Plus all the way.
reviews.title: Great Staff & Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And we entirely recommend the Metropolitan - - just not its self-important, supercilious, snobby, snooty naught of a restaurant. Of course, if they kept up that level of "service," they're probably out of business by now. Maybe a Wendy's takeover? ? ? :~)
reviews.title: Perfectly located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here on the last 2 days of our fortnight trip to Canada and took advantage of their special offer. The hotel is well situated in the heart of Vancouver. Its spotlessly clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious and had a wonderful comfortable bed. . Check out the swimming pool and spa on level 3 - it has a glass roof and a TV in the sauna. Very relaxing and just what you need before a 9 hour flight back to the UK! Highly recommended .
reviews.title: Great end to our holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as it was amongst the more affordable hotels in the central downtown area, and also based on previous reviews. From arriving, the service was excellent and all of the staff encountered were helpful and friendly. The room, at the front of the hotel, was spacious and included a small balcony from which Canada Place could be seen at the bottom of Howe St. The room facilities included everything you'd expect from a hotel of its class.
reviews.title: Hard to fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise, it could hardly be in a better location. For breakfast options outside of the hotel, there are two recommended places further down Howe St (going towards Canada Place) which are within 5 minutes walk. A shopping centre across the road features also features a large food hall. If you are staying for a few days and plan to explore different areas of the city, attractions in all four directions are within walking distance, especially if you don't mind a bit of a stroll. Alternatively, two Skytrain stations are close by and plenty of bus stops are within a minute or two of the hotel.
reviews.title: Comfort & elegance in centre of Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009
reviews.text: Highly recommended, and would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: I'm staying here next time I'm in Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vancover was our starting point for our 3 week tour of Western Canada. We wanted to start relaxed and in luxury and thats what we got. We stayed on the 10th floor for 4 days in a room with a small balcony looking down to Canada Place. The room was well equipped with tea coffee robes hairdryer iron and ironing board. The bathroom was massive and had an assortment of useful cosmetics. Bed was extremely comfy and we didnt hear anyone next door or in the hallway. Room was cleaned and made up everyday. We arrived at the hotel before check in but were given our room which was great after an 11hr flight. Reception staff very polite and friendly as were all staff we encountered. As we were out exploring everyday we didnt use the breakfast or dinner facilities. The pool was great for relaxing after sightseeing and after 8pm we were the only people using it, very relaxing. The hotel internet in the business suite is free for a limited time but WiFi is enabled in the rooms. Hotel is in an excellent location for exploring all Vancouver has to offer. When we return we will definately stay here, no complaints.
reviews.title: Excellent value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thumbs Up:
reviews.title: Friendly and attentive staff, great location, etc. = good value for your money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: -great location: 5 minutes walk from the downtown skytrain station, opposite the pacific mall, 10-15 minutes walk to robson street, 5 minutes walk to 7-eleven and tim horton’s (well known Canadian coffee/donut shop)
reviews.title: Great service, excellent location, fabulous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -friendly, pleasant and attentive staff
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: -lobby elegantly and tastefully decorated with an oriental flare
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with Friendly Staff and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: -fast complimentary internet access
reviews.title: Rooms a bit dated but good...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was wonderfully clean, comfortable and modern. We read reviews from others before travelling with mention of noise from construction work next door so we rang and asked for a room away from the site and they kindly fulfilled our request.
reviews.title: Comfortable, good location and friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location - we walked everywhere. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We especially appreciated the complimentary internet access as it was easy for us to get in touch with home, especially being so far from home.
reviews.title: Great Location but lacks the personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We highly recommend it and would definitely stay there again when we go back to Vancouver.
reviews.title: Thumbs up! Certainly would recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was billed as a 4 star hotel and certainly it was that. All the facilities are available at a cost. The location was great. I booked a King bed through Expedia but when we arrived I saw that we had twin beds. I did complain but I was told that that was what Expedia had put on the form to them. The breaksfast was very expensive for what you got (not that I had it). Everybody seems to eat in food courts in Vancouver and I must say you can get fed up of eating fast food. A lot of work is going on in preparation for the Winte Olympics in February 2010. I was shocked at the number of people who sleep on the streets and beg. The one thing I found was missing was the personal touch. Like all 4 and 5 star hotels, a service is provided in return for payment. Having stayed in 3 star hotels in San Francisco and Honolulu on the same holiday, the personal touch was very evident there but it was certainly lacking at this hotel. OF all three hotels, we enjoyed this the least. There was a lot of construction going on next door at their sister hotel but we were not advised of this until we found a letter in our room on arrival informing us of the fact and offering a simple apology. Do visit the Observatory and Stanley Park and the area around Canada Place. You can get by bus from the Airport for $14 each one way but I would recommend using the new Skytrain into the city for $3.75 each one way and it is much quicker by far. We also went to Whistler and I would recommend it to anyone visiting this area of Canada.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: booked this room through "Travelzoo" where they send one the top twenty specials of the week - Vancouver appears quite regularly - received an excellent rate through them - free parking and an upgrade to a king, luxury room
reviews.title: A touch of class

description: Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver - a luxury Vancouver hotel with a superb downtown location and yet at the same time positioned against a serene mountain backdrop. The hotel’s convenient downtown Vancouver location is surrounded by all the pleasures and excitement that one of Canada’s finest cities has to offer, whether you come for business or pleasure. Make yourself at home in one of the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver's 197 luxurious, elegantly appointed hotel rooms and suites, complete with spacious marble washrooms, separate glass showers and soaker tubs. The Vancouver hotel also offers 7,600 sq. ft. of conference and banquet facilities designed to accommodate 10 to 250. And, of course, nothing will satiate your appetite better than Diva at the Met restaurant, featuring Vancouver's finest cuisine, celebrated Chef's Table and distinguished wine cellar.
